thread.title: Golovkin stops Lemieux in 8th round for middleweight title
thread.title_full: Golovkin stops Lemieux in 8th round for middleweight title

title: Golovkin stops Lemieux in 8th round for middleweight title
text:
Updated: 12:14 a.m. Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015 | Posted: 12:14 a.m. Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015 Golovkin stops Lemieux in 8th round for middleweight title Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK â€” 
No big drama this time for Gennady Golovkin. Just a lot of big punches as he dominated his middleweight title fight with David Lemieux. 
Golovkin battered Lemieux around the ring Saturday night on the big stage at Madison Square Garden, landing punch after punch before the referee mercifully stepped in and stopped the fight in the eighth round. He remained unbeaten in 34 fights, and stopped his opponent for the 21st straight time. 
Fighting before a sold-out crowd of 20,548 cheering his every move, Golovkin was methodical as he knocked down Lemieux in the fourth round, bloodied his nose and dominated almost every second of the way. 
Lemieux was on the ropes taking punch after punch when Steve Willis finally stepped in at 1: 32 of the eighth round to call an end to the fight. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
